result.execSummary:
The defendant Justice S Marshall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Solicitation of Prostitutes, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.32.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit given for 139 days time served if revoked.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMEED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

miscConds.notes:
PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
Successfully complete a GED or HSED educational program.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Complete a parenting class.
Take any and all prescribed medications.
Comply with all CHIPS orders from Children's Court Center.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With release privileges for the Day Reporting Center, treatment, school, employment search, employment, and the Benedict Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justice S Marshall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (29 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing 10-02-2015 received and filed.

Defendant Justice S Marshall in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Cindy L. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS. 
Credit given for 139 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMEED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1, AMENDED): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 6 MONTHS "condition time" at the House of Correction with release privileges for the Day Reporting Center, treatment, school, employment search, employment, and the Benedict Center.
* No contact with the victim.
* Complete a parenting class.
* Successfully complete a GED or HSED educational program.
* Take any and all prescribed medications.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* The conditons of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
* Comply with all CHIPS orders from Children's Court Center.
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.

  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
SENTENCING MEMORANDUM filed by Atty. Nathan Opland-Dobs on behalf of the defendant.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Justice S Marshall in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Justice S Marshall in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Final Pretrial Conference today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.
State filed an Amended Information today.
Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended information and waived reading.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to:  Soliciting Prostitutes [a Class H FELONY], contrary to Wisconsin Stats. Sec. 944.32, 939.50(3)(h).

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case adjourned to 10-02-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.
Court CANCELED the 08-24-2015 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
filed by ADA Cynthia Davis on behalf of the State.
filed by ADA Cynthia Davis on behalf of the State.
filed by ADA Cynthia Davis on behalf of the State.
filed by ADA Cynthia Davis on behalf of the State.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Justice S Marshall not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received all discovery.  Bail argued by counsel.    Court denies motion to reduce bail.

Per Chief Judge Directive of 15-10, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Branch 02, Judge Joseph Donald, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Justice S Marshall in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Justice S Marshall in custody.  Jennifer Williams for Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Tim Behning-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed, MOTION FOR MODIFICATION OF BOND.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.H. (5/13/2002); PAMELA W.; KEITA J., AND TANISHA N.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Justice S Marshall in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Justice S Marshall in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
